title: Daniel Valdez
personalPhrase: I want to create my own world while programming it.

aboutMe.title: About Me
aboutMe.description:
I am a motivated young professional with boundless imagination and a strong commitment to computer science. Driven by an unceasing curiosity, I continually seek opportunities to enhance my experience in the ever-evolving technological landscape.

Currently, I am pursuing my studies at the Universidad del Valle de Guatemala, an institution renowned for its academic excellence and focus on innovation. Here, I continuously train in the latest technologies and systems used in the most professional and demanding work environments. This education has provided me with a solid foundation in areas such as software development, artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, and database management.

My focus is not limited to academics; I also actively participate in extracurricular projects and collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to develop innovative solutions. These experiences have allowed me to acquire practical skills and a deep understanding of how to apply my knowledge to solve real-world problems.

EverythingStarsWithWater.title: Everything Starts With Water
EverythingStarsWithWater.description: A captivating website developed with ReactJS that offers an immersive visual storytelling experience! Our mission is to address the critical challenge related to water resources by educating students about the water cycle and its profound implications for climate change. This project is designed to make learning about water engaging, informative, and impactful.

FastApiSocialNetwork.title: Fast Api: Social Network
FastApiSocialNetwork.description: The FastApi-SocialNetwork project is an API developed with FastAPI for a social network, designed to offer high performance and compatibility with Python 3.7+. It uses Neo4j for data management, providing robust model structures and Pydantic schemas.

SLR.title: Lexical Analyzer
SLR.description: The LexicalAnalyzer-LL1-SRL-Scanner project combines powerful lexical and syntactic analysis capabilities through an API developed in Go. It uses Yalex files to scan text and generate tokens, which are then used by an SLR table based on Yalp files for syntactic analysis. With a frontend interface in Angular, it provides an intuitive experience for interacting with text analysis functions, facilitating both text scanning and access to the SLR table.

danvaland.title: Danvaland
danvaland.description: Danvaland invites you to explore a collection of my fascinating projects hosted on GitHub. From dynamic web applications to polished UI designs, discover my creative vision and deep passion for technology. Join me on an exciting journey through innovative solutions and cutting-edge development.

TCP_chat.title: TCP Chat
TCP_chat.description: Welcome to the chat application project, an advanced solution developed in C++ to facilitate instant communication between users. This project includes two main components, client.cpp and server.cpp, designed to provide a smooth and secure messaging experience. Utilizing Google's Protocol Buffers (protobuf) for efficient data transmission, our application ensures robust management of registered users and concurrent sessions through the use of threads. Users can easily register, request lists of connected users, and enjoy an uninterrupted chat experience. This application is designed to be scalable and reliable, providing an ideal platform for various communication needs.

Doom_raycasting.title: Doom Raycasting
Doom_raycasting.description: This project is a technical demonstration of a Doom-style game developed in C++, using raycasting to generate real-time 3D graphics within a text console. Inspired by classics of the horror genre, the game offers an immersive and atmospheric experience, focusing on the effective implementation of rendering techniques to create visually impactful and tense environments. It compiles and runs easily via the run.sh script, providing an accessible showcase of raycasting potential in game creation.

B-line.title: B-Line
B-line.description: B-Line is a mobile application developed in Kotlin within the Android Studio environment. It aims to streamline the process of finding desired articles or products online by offering a robust search engine that scans various websites, organizes the results logically, and displays their prices and sources. Additionally, it allows users to filter results by category and save favorite items for easy access. B-Line enhances the online shopping experience by providing a centralized platform to discover and manage products efficiently.

Raycaster.title: Raycaster
Raycaster.description: This project demonstrates a simple raycasting engine to render a Minecraft-themed diorama. The scene includes blocks representing different materials such as light, gold, diamond, emerald, and beacon. Each material has specific optical properties like reflection and refraction.
